Posts.Content: Ok, you made me post. I wasn't gonna. Moopy, you don't have to just lay there to rest. Get a good book you've been wanting to read. Then tell Joe all the new info you have that he doesn't. I found this book in my son's room and started to read it. It is called "Self-Discovery" by Vladimir Savchenko which is translated by Antonina Bouis. It's a science fiction. Don't have it finished yet. Who would give up the chance to read? Make Joe get you an interesting book. P.S. Sometimes I buy a book when we go places and afterward it reminds me of that time. Maybe later in life you can say, "That is the time we went with the dogs for rads." On the inside cover write a little note to yourself, or Joe do it. Put the date also.
Posts.Title: Postponed again - oh well...

Posts.Content: I didn't use it. Not even sure how to get it as it is illegal where I went through treatment. We've talked about it before so don't be nervous.
Posts.Title: Medical MJ

Posts.Content: I'm clausterphobic too. What I did for the ct scans was close my eyes and pretend I was in the open room. Hang in there. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Got marked for radiation yesterday

Posts.Content: Diagnosed in 2003 with stage 3a, tumor was 6cm and 3cm. 2 of 15 lymph nodes with cancer. Tumor was so large that I had 4 cycles of A/C before modified radical mastectomy. 4 cycles of taxol (or taxotere sp?) after and then 6 weeks of radiation. I was on Tamoxifen for 9 months and Aromasin for 2 1/2 years. I thought I was done for but here I still am. You will get a better idea when you talk to the doctor and tell him your fear.
Posts.Title: Grade 3 of 3

Posts.Content: Robert Browning used it in 'Pippa Passes' 1841 because he misunderstood its meaning. He thought it meant 'hat'. I'm glad to know someone else didn't know what it meant. I had to look it up in Dictionary.com.
Posts.Title: Too funny

Posts.Content: The last letter of 'weight' and the first three of 'watchers'. Put that together.

Posts.Content: The word is weight watchers. Use the last letter and the three first letters and put it together. Took me a long time too. I had to go back and read the posting to figure it out.
Posts.Title: Too funny

Posts.Content: I read an article and that is what the fruit farmers are worried about too. But it's happened before and we got through it. It's always something.
Posts.Title: Strawberries are coming up!

Posts.Content: That makes three of us. I'm in the San Antonio area too.
Posts.Title: my choice to do chemo????

Posts.Content: Sounds like I had the same treatment as you. I did not have IBC but it was very aggressive. I had treatment in 2003/2004. Good luck tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Tomorrow's the "Day" (10--21-09)

Posts.Content: My parents both took 50+ pills a day. This included vitamins, minerals, and herbs. Anything that they came out and said it prevented something, they took. Both my parents were malnourished before they passed away.
Posts.Title: New Article on Vitamin Study: Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Yeah, you know you are all my friends anyway. I tend to ignore the plus or minus. So I hope no one takes offense if I don't add you because I'd have to add you all and it would probably just drive me crazy trying not to miss anyone so pretend I did it already.
Posts.Title: What does the + sign mean next to all of your names?

Posts.Content: I had 4 cycles of A/C chemo before surgery. Then had surgery about a month later. Didn't shrink as much as the surgeon liked I guess because they had me take 4 more cycles this time of Taxotere. Then waited another month and had 6 weeks of radiation. I didn't have the Herceptin but don't know why. I was a stage 3a with tumors of 6cm and 3cm. After the first 4 cycles I was a stage 2. The onc and surgeon should talk to each other and decide which treatment is best for you.
Posts.Title: Surgeon vs. Oncologist

Posts.Content: Faults are all over. Just some aren't active very much. The ones in the midwest tend to be felt over more distance.
Posts.Title: Anyone else feel the earthquake a little while ago??

Posts.Content: I'm upside down to defy gravity. Also as a kid I liked to lie on the sofa upside down and look at the ceiling and pretend we lived on the ceiling. Also life is upside down now. I guess that is why I like the upside down picture.
Posts.Title: What does the + sign mean next to all of your names?

Posts.Content: Good luck Eil. Whatever you do I hope you get some zzz's. I have found I can't sleep anymore unless I have a small fan blowing on me. I don't know if it's the buzz or the blowing air.

Posts.Content: Ok, I gave up being upside down to put what I think was 4th grade. My Mom always curled my hair for picture day. It's really stick straight.

Posts.Content: thanks for testing the private email for me. It does work! Pretty cool. I got a green box at the top that said I had a private message. That must be the aggressive part.
Posts.Title: Not the sharpest tool

Posts.Content: I only get the CSN newsletter at my home email. Didn't check anything special. When they converted this site only two boxes are checked (I didn't check them) to let me receive private emails and the aggressive notification. Haven't received any private emails here so don't know what that means (I wonder if it really works). Don't know what aggressive notification is either (sounds like something I should uncheck because it could be a nuisance)! Sorry I'm no help at all.

Posts.Title: metastatic breast cancer and SURVIVING AN ABUSIVE EX-HUSHAND

Posts.Content: I'll be thinking of you. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Last Week & This Week & Next Week

Posts.Content: That's the first thing I asked my surgeon after the surgery, How much weight did I lose? I thought there had to be a good side to getting a hunk off. He said a couple ounces. Darn, I thought it'd be a pound or two anyway. All my heavy fat must be in my hips. RE, what are you doing up at 2:06am?
Posts.Title: CONFESSIONS OF A GOOF

Posts.Content: I haven't owned one of those for a number of years. Last time I went close to the water I wore t-shirt and those bike pants. I think they are more comfortable. I don't swim anyway so I don't get in the water, just wade.
Posts.Title: CONFESSIONS OF A GOOF

Posts.Content: We have been remodeling the bathroom so didn't see the holiday coming. Plus since its a Holiday you really need reservations. I think we will be staying home and trying to get the bathroom finished. We are also making it as disabled friendly as we can.
Posts.Title: OT : I am Camping this long weekend-ANYONE else?

Posts.Content: Have a heart to heart with your son and tell him how you feel.
Posts.Title: My son is graduating

Posts.Content: It's hard to understand why these things happen but someday we will. He is out of pain but it is still painfull for his loved ones. Very sad for them. I know. We have no power to lengthen anyones life. I'm beginning to think we have a time and when it's up, that's it. We should make the most of each day we do receive.
Posts.Title: Sorry to post such bad news

Posts.Content: Diagnosis date Aug. 5, 2003.   Glad to hear you are doing  well.   Happy Holidays to all!   Marcia
Posts.Title: Old guard here....busy with life....10 years later....

Posts.Content: I found mine but it was more of a invasion than a lump. I had three tumors, 6cm, 3cm and a smaller one. So my breast was solid. These did not show up on the mammogram or ultrasound but the doctors knew it was cancer, it was just difficult to find because they were working blind (the first surgeon I saw did the biopsies in the wrong place). The oncologist said it grew to that size in one year. I had chemo before surgery and still had two lymph nodes with cancer. My oncologist did say it was aggressive and they were treating me aggressively. They called mine ductal carsonoma. I had 4 cycles of chemo, surgery, 4 more cycles of chemo and then 6 weeks of radiation. I had the chemo once every three weeks also but I didn't get the port. The oncologist mentioned it but no one pushed the issue because I had very good veins. Didn't have any problem.
Posts.Title: Port and Chemo

Posts.Content: I went to your expressions page and couldn't see anything! :>( I'm doing something wrong. I wanna see too!

Posts.Title: Sisters

Posts.Content: We will all be there in spirit. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Ultrasound tomorrow

Posts.Content: The surgeon puts in the port. My first onc visit he did an examination of the breasts and looked over the test results (I had already seen the surgeon and he had arranged for the tests. he is who decided I needed chemo first) and told me what chemo I'd receive and for how long. Then set up my first chemo treatment a couple days from then. I didn't get a port. My doctors didn't ask my opinion altho at that time I didn't know enough to form an opinion or ask questions.

I just have to remember the other advice which is never talk with your mouth full. On second thought these don't apply to typing but if the fork is in the hand by the time it's empty I've probably forgotten anyway. I never could do two things at once so I can't eat and post at the same time.

Posts.Title: Do you want to know something sisters in pink?

Posts.Content: I had an MRI when they diagnosed me. They inject you with dye so things show up better. It's over quickly so try not to focus on that. I was scared of needles also and didn't even have anything when I had my kids. But this is different and is needed. Try to think of happy thoughts or places when they insert the needle. Try not to think about it. You can do it.
Posts.Title: I'm scared

Posts.Content: Hope they can give you some relief soon. I'll be thinking of you tomorrow and that it helps with your health. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Feeling Bad but Looking forward to Heart Cath Tomorrow

Posts.Content: IMHP a Chrysler minivan is the best. It transports dogs cause it's got two bench seats and if you need to transport stuff you can take the seats out. We've carried drywall and lumber and all kinds of stuff in ours. It's wonderful in the snow too. Front wheel drive and higher than a car so you can see better too. I haven't seen the new ones tho so maybe I should put in a disclaimer.
Posts.Title: Aortus and his new car .. Joe here are a few suggestions for you, from your fellow Kindered Spirits

Posts.Content: You might want to check with your oncologist about weight loss during this treatment. When I was going through treatment they didn't want me to try and lose weight. I didn't have exactly the same treatment as you but it would be safe to ask.
Posts.Title: What side effects with Taxol and Herceptin?

Posts.Content: I'm not crazy about snakes but at one house we lived in we found two that my husband killed. We thought they were poisonous. Then one day found a third and felt guilty about killing them when we didn't know. So managed to get it into an old water boiler (a tub they used to put on the stove to heat water) and took it over to a snake farm (like a snake zoo). The guy said it wasn't poisonous just looked simular. It's natures way of protecting them so other preditors will show respect. He said it was a rat snake and was good for the neighborhood.
Posts.Title: O.M.G.!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: When they call to preregister me I just said I preferred to wait till I got there. I'm having a different problem. I've requested my records be sent to a follow-up doctor in another state and myself and they never send the treatment records. Just the follow-up records. So the follow-up docs just go by what I tell them. Always get copies of all treatments and visits so you don't have to go through this. I didn't.

Posts.Content: What kind of anti nausous medication are you on? Not Reglan, I hope. A serious side effect is tardive dyskinesia. FDA has a warning against it.

Posts.Content: I had 4 A/C (once every three weeks) before surgery to shrink the tumor. Then had 4 taxotere after surgery (once every 3 weeks). If the first 4 don't work, the surgeon will know after surgery. It didn't work completely for me (it decreased me to a stage 2 however) and that is why I had to have the additional chemo after surgery. Doesn't mean you will because everybody is different.

Posts.Title: age when diagnosed?

Posts.Content: Happy birthday!

I had six weeks of a/c. Surgery, and six weeks of Taxotere. Then six weeks of radiation. I was diagnosed in 2003 as a stage 3a. I lost my hair after the second treatment of a/c but it started to grow back after surgery. There was a month between chemo and surgery. and another month after surgery till i started Taxotere. I lost what hair did grow back when I started Taxotere. But radiation did not stop the hair from growing. My hair is very straight but when it grew back it was curly. This did not last for as it grew out it became exactly as it was. Straight.  Hang in there.

Posts.Content: I was 52 when diagnosed August 2003.

Posts.Content: It's a funny thing about the future. You can't see it because it's always around a corner. Help could be around that corner. Calling the ACS is a good idea. If you had been working and now can't because of a disability you could also call the social security office and see if you qualify for disability payments. I hope you find what you are looking for.
Posts.Title: surviving after cancer

Posts.Content: Your hubby gets a pat on the back. If everyone did what was right (sometimes it's hard to tell) then it'd be a better world.
Posts.Title: OT - So proud of Hubby today

Posts.Content: When I was on it I didn't gain but I started to exercise and lost a little that I had gained on chemo. Not a lot and it was slow but I didn't gain.
Posts.Title: am I destined to be fat while on tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Our dog is part of our family. So sorry.
Posts.Title: my dog has cancer

Posts.Content: Maybe they are taking so long because she is having complications. I had a large tumor also, 6cm and 3cm and another smaller one and also had 2 of 15 lymph nodes with cancer (they gave me chemo before surgery so there could have been more) and I was still staged at 3a. I thought stage 4 was if they found it in other places besides breast or lymph nodes. I had to wait a month after surgery for more chemo. Then 6 weeks of radiation. The surgeon did give me a treatment plan after biopsy but changed it slightly after the surgery. All I can do is tell you what treatment I got but my circumstances are different. When you go to the oncology appointment maybe you should ask why you weren't told of a treatment plan sooner? Write down everything you want to ask. I hope things start going better for you and your mom.
Posts.Title: Did anyone else have to wait 5 weeks to see oncology?

Posts.Content: Going Flat posted by TracieinLA. Maybe this article would help you decide.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed in September 2016

Posts.Content: If you want to see doctors profile in New Jersey here is the link: http://12.150.185.184/dca/about.jsp New York state has a simular site to check backgrounds. Just Google physician profiles and the state.
Posts.Title: Hi

Posts.Content: I don't know but I did see an article once where someone was taking donated clothes to used clothes stores and selling them. Hard to tell about any charity unless you check into it. Scam, scam, go away Never come back any day Go get a real job and let us play. :>) Or post.
Posts.Title: This could be a scam....or not!

Posts.Content: I had 4 cycles of A/C (one every three weeks) before surgery. After surgery I had 4 cycles (one every three weeks) of taxotere. I only had one shot the next day when my counts were down a little. The taxotere was clear stuff and dripped into the IV (I didn't have a port). The nurse sat and watched me the first time to see if I had a reaction. I did and they had to slow down the drip. So what should have been fairly fast (like an hour) turned into two or three. I don't remember now. This was back in 2003/2004 so they might have changed things since then. Hope all goes well and soon you will be done!
Posts.Title: 12 weeks of taxol

Posts.Content: None of us know how our choices will turn out but I have found that choices which are felt deeply to be the correct choice usually is the way to go. In later life if you wonder if you made the right choice, thinking about the reasons why you did it will comfort you. Be true to yourself. Hugs!
Posts.Title: Off topic....may be my last dutch treat....sigh....

Posts.Content: Congratulations on 6 year mark. Whose doing the happy dance!

Posts.Title: Immune system and travel to third world countries

Posts.Content: You need to at least have one taken for Reggie to have. Even if no one else gets to see it. The good thing about pictures, you get to pick the ones that make you look the best and tear up the others. As for the pictures that were destroyed. Contact uncles, aunts, cousins or friends and see if they have any pictures of your family and ask for copies. This is my opinion but some day a descendant may wonder what you look like. That means descendants of siblings or cousins too.

Posts.Content: So sorry for your loss. It wasn't your fault and nothing you could do. We had a close friend who committed suicide and he didn't give us one idea what he was going to do. Don't blame yourself. I'm so sorry.

Posts.Content: Good luck with your second treatment. I got very sick but that was in 2003 and I believe they have better medications now to help. Make sure your onc knows you are having trouble and they can give you suggestions and help. The nurse told me to keep something in my stomach so I'd eat a cracker which seemed to help.

Posts.Content: I look at it as our little birdies have learned to use their wings. We should be happy for them. I guess that was the purpose all along. I confess tho, I miss them too.

Posts.Title: 3 RD Treatment Tomorrow

Posts.Content: You should know by now we don't need to be begged to say what we think. :) I got a pair of Easy Spirit shoes two or three years ago and love them. I had to have something that didn't tie. The pair I got is no longer on their site but the Astra is close. Here is the site- http://www.easyspirit.com/ They actually have a lot on sale now. I like trying on my shoes first and bought mine at JCPenney's. I need shoes with lots of support.

Posts.Content: I was just thinking about you today! I hope and pray the meds will bring your numbers up.
Posts.Title: Hey checking in just got out of hospital need prayers

Posts.Content: I think that is our biggest fear, of recurrence. Several on the boards are stage 4. I was stage 3 in 2003. I think they have improved treatment since then. Good luck with treatment.

Posts.Content: I agree, some say tomato and some say tomato...well you had to hear the song. Bravo anyway!
Posts.Title: Hands off, girls -- NED is all mine today!

Posts.Content: $35 for a flip flop??? And that was the cheap one! Wow. Out of my price range. And gee did you see that spike? I'd fall off.
Posts.Title: Request for a VIRTUAL INTERVENTION with my wife Moopy

Posts.Content: My onc didn't want me taking multivitamins. Everything needs to be ok'd by onc. You need to be careful that anything doesn't interfere with chemo.
Posts.Title: Supplements to strengthen immunity?

Posts.Content: Hang in there. There will be days or moments like that but than there will be happy great moments also. Just try to get well and take care of yourself. When I feel like that I put a funny good movie on that I've seen a lot. Then if you dose off it doesn't matter because you already know what you missed when you wake up. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Feeling Down

Posts.Content: We lived about three years in Kentucky years ago. We liked going to drive-in theaters because it was a good value. Since we were new to the area we stopped at a gas station and asked where the 'out door' was. That's what we called a drive-in theater. The attendant (this was when they came out to the car to pump your gas for you) said, "Oh we moved that inside a few years ago!" When talking to your doctor make sure you use the same terminology or you may find yourself in the bathroom.
Posts.Title: communication

Posts.Content: We gave up watching commercial tv a couple years ago. We have a tv but use it for DVD's. Too many commercials and not enough quality shows. I even gave up radio for a long time but started listening the other week. I tune the commercials out and don't listen. I may start just playing CD's. I also gave up magazines. Have you noticed how many drug ads are in them? It's my life and I'm not going to take it any more. I read the news online and when I get a pop up ad that the filter didn't catch I close the article. If I click on a video and they play a commercial first I shut it off. I won't tollerate it. Maybe I'm eccentric but that's the way it is.
Posts.Title: BC Commercials...Ranting!

Posts.Content: I had trouble with spotting after being on Tamoxifen 9 months. The onc took a blood test to determine if I was in menopause. I was so he sent me to a OBGYN. She did an ultrasound and a pap and a biopsy. All were fine so she did a hysteroscopy (just taking a look) and then a D&C. I had uterine polyps. She didn't say anything about the wall thickening. The onc didn't know if the Tamoxifen had anything to do with the spotting but switched my medication just in case.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & bleeding, increased thickness uterin walls

Posts.Content: My oncologist switched me to Aromasin after being on Tamoxifen about 8 or 9 months. I had started to spot and because I also had a sister who had uterine cancer, he ran a test to make sure I was in menopause, and switched me just in case it had something to do with it. I ended up having a D&C and I had uterine polyps. The Tamoxifen made my body a furnace but so did Aromasin. Just make sure you see your gynecologist once a year.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen..How did everyone do on it??

Posts.Content: For me it got better after I finished chemo. I was nauseous all during. Radiation had it's own problems but at least I wasn't feeling sick during it. Find as many pleasant things to do as you can and make new friends. You just have to heal so try to help your body by eating right and exercise when you can. You are still you inside. Hang in there.
Posts.Title: Where do I go from here?

Posts.Content: If you are goofy than I'm Donald Duck! Quack ack.
Posts.Title: Doing Well

Posts.Content: yeah, what is a prothesis kit? Do you have to sew your own like JoMama? She may have to give you some tips.
Posts.Title: Replacement Parts, On the way!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: I was stage 3A also. My tumors were 6cm and 3cm. I had 4 rounds of chemo A/C and surgery. I knew I'd also need radiation but after surgery I was told I'd need 4 more rounds of chemo which were Taxotere. I was very upset because I didn't want 3 more chemo rounds. After the surgery I was decreased to 2A. I got thru it and then had the radiation. Radiation was easier but you have to watch the skin and make sure you aren't getting burned. After each radiation treatment ask the doc to check the area. Mine didn't and I got burnt and had to take a break till I healed. When I was on radiation I got very tired.    The way it was explained to me was radiation kills any cancer that is in the surgery site. Chemo kills cancer that is in the body. but chemo doesn't absorb well in the surgery site. That is how it was explained to me.  I went through treatment 2003-2004. I did not have reconstruction and only had one breast removed. They found 5 lymph nodes (it's been a long time and this is what I remember) with cancer out of 15 they removed.
Posts.Title: Help Please,very confused, radiation?

Posts.Content: Yes, I was given a colorful plastic one by the PT to use if I have to go back into the hospital. It's to get their attention. I have another that I ordered from national Lymphedema Network Inc. 1-800-541-3259 I forget how much it was but it was between $5 and $10. I've added a picture of it on my expressions page. Couldn't get the words to show real good but it gives you an idea of what it looks like. It says: LYMPHEDEMA ALERT NO BLOOD PRESSURE NO NEEDLES INTO THIS ARM
Posts.Title: MEDICAL BRACELETS

Posts.Content: I'm just telling you how I reacted to chemo to give you an idea of how different it is for each of us. I would feel fine until 30 minutes after and would bearly get home and start throwing up. All the rest of that day I couldn't keep anything in. The next day was better but still nauseous. It would take about a week to start feeling better. I started wearing a shirt that I didn't like to treatment just incase I developed an aversion to it. They must have thought that is the only shirt I had. When I got home I would put on a bathrobe. The problem was I got sick after I got home and had the bathrobe on. It was new but after treatment it still made me nauseous so I gave it to Goodwill. I had other minor problems but I remember the nausea the most. It did with each treatment last longer but also I would think how much closer to being finished I was. I was also very tired and could fall asleep watching tv. I am a five year survivor and lots of the bad stuff is fading from memory. I did like eating Chinese restaurant fried rice. It seemed to make me feel better when I could eat. The oncology nurse told me to eat a cracker or something if I felt nauseous. She said something in my stomach would make me feel better.
Posts.Title: Do Chemo treatments get worse each time?

Posts.Content: Payday loans are high interest. It'd be like hocking something at a pawn shop. This is a good way to really keep you behind the curve. OK I admit back in the 70's we used to pawn a tape player to make it to payday. Then get it back after payday. We did this constantly until we figured out how to cut back our budget. We also paid a bunch for this. If you really can't find a job, try temporary agencies. Sometimes it's a good way for a company to see what you can do and you can see how you like them.
Posts.Title: Job Interview Questions

Posts.Content: I found a site that explains Protocel http://www.cancer.gov/cancertopics/pdq/cam/cancell/patient Doesn't sound like it works.
Posts.Title: natural cure stuff

Posts.Content: I started spotting and I had to have a D&C after 9 months on Tamoxifen but don't know if it contributed to it or not. I had polyps. But the onc determined I was in menopause and switched me to Aromasin because of family history (I had a sister who had uterine cancer).
Posts.Title: D & C again (just had 6mths ago)

Posts.Content: All I can say is keep applying. Maybe apply for jobs where the credit is not such a big deal. In my experience if you hit it off with the interviewer, they may make allowances. I've interviewed for jobs that I was qualified for and the interviewer was my sons age. He instantly took a dislike to me because I hadn't worked for a few years. He wanted to know what I'd been doing all this time. In my head I was thinking, "Go ask your mother sonny boy." I didn't get hired. This was before cancer. So you just have to hang in there and keep applying and keep smiling. One job I applied for said all they wanted was a smiling face. I guess I didn't smile enough. :) :) :)
Posts.Title: Job Interview Questions

Posts.Content: You might have a heart to heart talk with the surgeon. If you had the second biopsy during chemo that could be why it took so long to heal. Tell him/her your fears. Let them explain. Usually that helps.
Posts.Title: Does anyone ever say no. . .

Posts.Content: My onc didn't tell me my percent but just said it was helping slightly. So I took it till I had problems and switched to something else and finally just stopped altogether. It was hard to get info out of my docs unless I knew what to ask and I didn't know anything. Oh well.
Posts.Title: No tamoxifen for me

Posts.Content: I agree. There are Al-Anon meetings to help families of alcoholics. Good luck what ever you do.

Posts.Title: ((( CLAUDIA )))) AKA ((( CHENHEART))) Just following up..

Posts.Content: I had a bone scan a year or so after treatment because I was having hip pain and they wanted to rule out cancer. Never found out what caused it but it wasn't cancer.
Posts.Title: Bone Scan vs Bone Density test

Posts.Content: Lynn: I love your yoga picture with the books behind.
Posts.Title: Members of the BC Sisterhood

Posts.Content: I was in the same place. I had very large tumors (6cm,3cm,and another smaller) in the right breast. I had A/C chemo for 4 cycles before surgery (I still had 2 nodes infected out of 15.)and Taxotere for 4 cycles after surgery. I had 6 weeks of radiation after chemo. I questioned my surgeon about it coming back in the other breast and he said it wouldn't. Not sure how he could have been so sure. He never suggested taking it off too. I was diagnosed in 2003. Maybe have them explain to you why they feel the other doesn't need to be removed so you will understand their thinking. Or you could get a second opinion.
Posts.Title: Masectomy or Double Masectomy

Posts.Content: I found it was more stressful to have it falling out than to just cut it off. Finding big clumps of hair upset me. Hang in there. Hugs.
Posts.Title: I'm BUZZED (clipper buzzed that is)

Posts.Content: Ah Mimi, I'm sorry. I always view you as a very upbeat, take charge, type of person. I didn't know you were down right now. We all have those times. When I get like that I don't feel like posting either. Wish I could wave the magic wand and make everything right. This feeling will pass and you will be all the things you want to be again. Hugs.
Posts.Title: I'm having a hard time...

Posts.Content: I did not have reconstruction. My surgeon said I'd have to wait till after radiation. I've heard of woman who didn't have to so not sure what he was thinking. I didn't know about this board at the time and had limited knowledge. I healed fine from surgery. I thought about getting reconstruction a year after treatment but my surgeon had a heart attack and I decided I'd just not go with someone else. Sometimes its hard living with just one but I'm 59 and it doesn't bother me as much as it would someone younger.
Posts.Title: Masectomy or Double Masectomy

Posts.Content: All you need for an automatic ball washer is a dog. If you don't know what I mean, well, my lips are sealed. (they like to mark territory that another animal has you-know-what on)
Posts.Title: I'm having a hard time...

Posts.Content: I was not given a take home kit or 7 shots. I don't like shots and feel for you. Could you call the doctor and ask?
Posts.Title: Has anyone had the 7 day take home shots "lovenox" after surgery for blood clots?

Posts.Content: I got this recipe from our RE and I have to warn you when mixing make sure the egg is mixed in thoroughly. I had some egg that wasn't and it exploded the chocolate mix all over the microwave.
